alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 06 at 2:07AM AKST until November 07 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM AKST MONDAY NORTH AND WEST OF KING SALMON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 8 inches, highest amounts north and west of Dillingham. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibility as low as one half mile. * WHERE...Bristol Bay, north and west of King Salmon. * WHEN...From 9 PM Sunday to 9 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Expect difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong front quickly tracks eastward towards western Alaska late Sunday. Gusty southeasterly winds along the front move inland overnight Sunday into Monday. Heavy snowfall combined with strong winds will reduce visibilities around the same time. A brief period of freezing rain will develop along the Bristol Bay coast. Warmer air will then help transition to all rain for Monday afternoon and evening as the front advances eastward.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
